The President reported the appointment of a Special Interim
Advisory Committee regarding steps toward strengthening the Ameri-
can Council on Education with the following membership: 0. C.
Aderhold; Louis T. Benezet; C. Clement French; Edmund J. Gleazer,
Jr.; Thomas H. Hamilton; Gaylord P. Harnwell; David D. Henry, ex
officio; Theodore M. Hesburgh, C.S.C.; 0. Meredith Wilson; and
Logan Wilson, ex officio. It was VOTED that authorization be
given to the continuance of this Committee until the President of
the American Council on Education meets with the new Board of
Directors.
The President reported the resignation of J. L. Morrill as
Chairman of the Africa Liaison Committee and the appointment of
Arthur S. Adams as Chairman. He also announced the appointment
of the following new members: R. Taylor Cole and Payson S. Wild.
New Business
Upon request from the Committee on Urban Renewal, supported
by the President's recommendation, it was VOTED to establish the
proposed urban renewal project subject to the availability of
financial resources. In brief this project would establish an
office to supply special services to colleges and universities
directly involved in urban renewal programs, including detailed
information on the progress of such programs, a close liaison
with the Federal Urban Renewal Agency, and access to expert legal
counsel on matters of general policy. It is believed that the
fifty or more institutions directly concerned would be willing to
underwrite the costs of such a project for an experimental period
of three years. The proposed annual budget is $47,585.
The request from the United States Office of Education
regarding a project of simplifying and standardizing degree nomen¬
clature and degree abbreviations was presented. Lnterest of the
Committee was expressed and it was VOTED to authorize the Presi¬
dent to appoint a special committee to consider ways and means
of proceeding with the project.
The President reported a request from the United States
Office of Education that the Council undertake a project con¬
cerning problems of copyrights, royalties, compensation, and
teacher rights in the production, performance, and distribution
of educational radio and television programs, educational films,
and programs for teaching machines. It was VOTED to approve the
project, to receive the necessary funds, and to authorize the
President of the Council to organize the project. The Committee
expressed the view that people that are centrally concerned with
instructional work in colleges and universities should be in¬
volved.
